page.title: 09THE LYON MEMORIAL HALL
page.content: Mrs. Margaret Powell came to see us about the{Lyon Hall}for our Domesday Project. Many schools (about 13,000) have done this project. The{Lyon Hall}is a red brick building which stands at the side of the A53, opposite the Hearne Lane. It is the main meeting place of the village of Hodnet. Mrs. Powell told us about the activities that go on in the{Lyon Hall Many things are held there such as the Gardening Club for older people, dancing for young people, Discos, the School Speech Day, The School Concert, Private Parties and Meetings. {The Lyon Hall}was named after Dr. Lyon when he died. His wife, Mrs Lyon, laid the foundation stone in 1913. In 1983 a new extension was added and opened by the MP for Oswestry, Mr. John Biffen. Allen Worrall age 11
